name: focus
title: :focus Selector
desc: Selects element if it is currently focused.

examples.desc: Adds the focused class to whatever element has focus
examples.html: a div

entries.longdesc: As with other pseudo-class selectors (those that begin with a ":"), it is recommended to precede :focus with a tag name or some other selector; otherwise, the universal selector ( "*" ) is implied. In other words, the bare $( ":focus" ) is equivalent to $( "*:focus" ). If you are looking for the currently focused element, $( document.activeElement ) will retrieve it without having to search the whole DOM tree.
